atkId_Bullet.Wiki: Set the attack parameters that are applied when this bullet impacts a victim.

sfxId_Bullet.Wiki: SFX ID before acceleration. If the SFX ID after acceleration is -1, this SFX will continue to fly even after acceleration.

sfxId_Hit.Wiki: Impact SFX ID. -1 means it does not occur.

sfxId_Flick.Wiki: SFX ID when repelling projectile. -1 means it does not occur.

life.Wiki: Time for projectile to exist in flight (-1 is infinite). In seconds.

dist.Wiki: If the bullet flight distance exceeds this value, the attenuation set by other parameters will be applied.

gravityInRange.Wiki: Gravity applied downward within range. In metres per second ^ 2.

gravityOutRange.Wiki: Gravity applied downward outside of range. In metres per second ^ 2.

shootInterval.Wiki: The interval at which the projectile is emitted. Applied when generated via the TAE Bullet Behavior event. In seconds.

hormingStopRange.Wiki: The distance at which the bullet homing will stop being applied.

accelInRange.Wiki: Acceleration whilst projectile is within distance threshold. In metres per second ^ 2.

accelOutRange.Wiki: Acceleration whilst projectile is beyond the distance threshold. In metres per second ^ 2.

maxVellocity.Wiki: The maximum speed of the bullet. In metres per second.

minVellocity.Wiki: The minimum speed of the bullet. In metres per second.

accelTime.Wiki: The delay before the projectile will start accelerating. In seconds.

homingBeginDist.Wiki: The distance at which projectile homing will start to be applied.

hitRadius.Wiki: The initial radius of the hitbox.

hitRadiusMax.Wiki: The maximum radius of the hitbox, the duration for the hitbox to change from initial to max radius is determined by spreadTime. (If -1, radius is same as initial hitbox radius).

spreadTime.Wiki: The amount of time takes for hitbox radius to grow from initial value to max value. If 0, only the initial radius is used. In seconds.

expDelay.Wiki: The duration from the projectile landing to the start of hit radius expansion (if 0, it expands immediately).

hormingOffsetRange.Wiki: If set to 0, the projectile will track with perfect accuracy. Otherwise, the target location is offset by this amount in the direction to victim is moving.

dmgHitRecordLifeTime.Wiki: The interval at which damage can be applied by this bullet to a victim. 0 means it will only ever apply once.

externalForce.Wiki: The external force modifier to apply to the projectile in the direction of shooting (Y-axis is removed) based on map factor.

spEffectIDForShooter.Wiki: The SpEffect applied to owner of bullet upon being emitted.

autoSearchNPCThinkID.Wiki: The think parameters used by the funnel to search for the target (e.g. soulmass).

HitBulletID.Wiki: The bullet to generate when the projectile expires, or conditionally according to some launchConditionType values.

spEffectId0.Wiki: The SpEffect to apply when the projectile hits target.

spEffectId1.Wiki: SpEffect to apply when the projectile hits target.

spEffectId2.Wiki: SpEffect to apply when the projectile hits target.

spEffectId3.Wiki: SpEffect to apply when the projectile hits target.

spEffectId4.Wiki: SpEffect to apply when the projectile hits target.

numShoot.Wiki: The number of projectiles produced per emitter interval.

homingAngle.Wiki: The amount of tracking correction made each second, affecting the speed the projectile faces the victim. In degrees per second.

shootAngle.Wiki: Specify the horizontal angle at which the projectile should be fired, offset from the emitter origin. In degrees.

shootAngleInterval.Wiki: When firing multiple projectiles, specify the horizontal angle interval at which to fire (Y-axis). In degrees.

shootAngleXInterval.Wiki: When firing multiple projectiles, specify the vertical angle interval at which to fire (X-axis). Positive angle upwards, negative angle downwards. In degrees.

damageDamp.Wiki: After passing attenuation distance, Physical damage falls off by this % every second.

spelDamageDamp.Wiki: After passing attenuation distance, Magic damage falls off by this % every second.

fireDamageDamp.Wiki: After passing attenuation distance, Fire damage falls off by this % every second.

thunderDamageDamp.Wiki: After passing attenuation distance, Lightning damage falls off by this % every second.

staminaDamp.Wiki: After passing attenuation distance, Stamina damage falls off by this % every second.

knockbackDamp.Wiki: After passing attenuation distance, knockback falls off by this % every second.

shootAngleXZ.Wiki: Specify the vertical angle of the projectile that should be fired. Positive values angle upwards, negative values angle downwards. In degrees.

lockShootLimitAng.Wiki: The maximum angle the bullet's initial direction can change to face towards player locked-on target or AI focused enemy. In degrees.

isPenetrate.Wiki: If ON, allows a projectile to pierce through enemies and objects. Also potentially allows hitting the same enemy multiple times using dmgHitRecordLifetime. See isPenetrateMap to ignore map.

prevVelocityDirRate.Wiki: The ratio to add the previous movement direction to the current direction when the sliding projectile hits the wall.

atkAttribute.Wiki: Attack attribute to use when applying attack against the victim.

spAttribute.Wiki: Special attributes to use when applying attack against the victim.

Material_AttackType.Wiki: Specify the particles and sounds to apply for the attack against the victim.

Material_AttackMaterial.Wiki: Specify the particles and sounds to apply for the attack against the victim.

Material_Size.Wiki: Specify the size of the particles to apply for the attack against the victim.

launchConditionType.Wiki: Conditions required for HitBulletID to generate upon impact or expiration.

isAttackSFX.Wiki: If ON, the projectile SFX will remain stuck in the victim it it collides.

isEndlessHit.Wiki: If ON, the projectile will hit continously upon impact.

isPenetrateMap.Wiki: If ON, the projectile will pass through collision and map pieces.

isHitBothTeam.Wiki: If ON, the projectile will collide with both victim and owner team types.

isUseSharedHitList.Wiki: If ON, multiple projectile from the same emitter that collide with a victim will count as one projectile in terms of updating the damage interval.

isUseMultiDmyPolyIfPlace.AltName: Use Multiple Dummy Polygons for Emit
isUseMultiDmyPolyIfPlace.Wiki: If ON, multiple dummy polygons with shared ID can be used for emitting the projectile.

attachEffectType.Wiki: The deflection type for this projectile against other projectiles.

isHitForceMagic.Wiki: If ON, this projectile can be deflected by projectiles with attachEffectType set to 1.

isIgnoreSfxIfHitWater.AltName: Block Hit Particle Emit on Water Collision
isIgnoreSfxIfHitWater.Wiki: If ON, do not emit the hit particle if the projectile hits the water surface

isIgnoreMoveStateIfHitWater.Wiki: If ON, the projectile will pass through water collision.

isHitDarkForceMagic.Wiki: If ON, this projectile can be deflected by projectiles with attachEffectType set to 3.

Option.Name: Nearby victim origin. If no victims, targets projectile origin.
